ServerPackage.ServerControllers

Class ShopController

  • java.lang.Object
    • ServerPackage.ServerControllers.ShopController
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable, SCCommunicationConstants

    public class ShopController
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Runnable, SCCommunicationConstants
    The shop controller class that handles requests for information from the server controller. Handles logic used in all shop features.
    Since:
    April 5, 2019
    Version:
    2.0
    Author:
    Jake Liu, Shamez Meghji, Victor Sanchez

    • Method Detail

      • readClientOpeningMessage

        private boolean readClientOpeningMessage()
        Read opening messages from the client, translate it into opcode, and then respond appropriately.
        Returns:
        False if the user quits.

      • convertOpeningMessageToOpcode

        public int convertOpeningMessageToOpcode(java.util.Scanner openingMessageScanner)
        Converts the opening message into opcode.
        Parameters:
        openingMessageScanner - The scanner scanning the opening message. Needs to be starting at the front.
        Returns:
        the opcode representation of the opening message.

      • convertOpeningMessageOperationToOpcode

        private int convertOpeningMessageOperationToOpcode(java.lang.String operationKeyword)
        Converts the opening message Operation keyword into a number value. Operation keyword values are in the 1000s
        Parameters:
        operationKeyword - The Operation keyword of the opening message.
        Returns:
        The opcode representation of the Operation keyword.

      • convertOpeningMessageArgDegreeToOpcode

        private int convertOpeningMessageArgDegreeToOpcode(java.lang.String argDegreeKeyword)
        Converts the opening message Argument Degree keyword into a number value. Argument Degree keyword values are in the 100s
        Parameters:
        argDegreeKeyword - The Argument Degree keyword of the opening message.
        Returns:
        The opcode representation of the Argument Degree keyword.

      • convertOpeningMessageArgTypeToOpcode

        private int convertOpeningMessageArgTypeToOpcode(java.lang.String argTypeKeyword)
        Converts the opening message Argument Type keyword into a number value. Argument Type keyword values are in the 10s
        Parameters:
        argTypeKeyword - The Argument Type keyword of the opening message.
        Returns:
        The opcode representation of the Argument Type keyword.

      • convertOpeningMessageArgExtraToOpcode

        private int convertOpeningMessageArgExtraToOpcode(java.lang.String argExtraKeyword)
        Converts the opening message Extra Argument keyword into a number value. Extra Argument keyword values are in the 1s
        Parameters:
        argExtraKeyword - The Extra Argument keyword of the opening message.
        Returns:
        The opcode representation of the Extra Argument keyword.

      • actOnOpCode

        private void actOnOpCode(int opcode,
                         int extraParamInt,
                         java.lang.String extraParamString)
        Make the shop do something based on the given opcode. opcodes are translated from keywords in SCCommunicationConstants as follows: Operation keyword: 1 = Data is being sent to the client. Thousands digit: 2 = Data needs to be added or updated/replaced. 3 = Data needs to be created. 4 = Data needs to be deleted. 5 = Data needs to be verified or searched for. ArgDegree keyword: 1 = Mainly involves only a single object. Hundreds digit: 2 = Mainly involves a list of objects. ArgType keyword: 1 = Concerns items. Tens digit: 2 = Concerns suppliers. 3 = Concerns orders/order lines. ArgExtra keyword: 0 = User-defined objects will be needed. Ones digit: 1 = An integer in the opening message will be needed. 2 = A String in the opening message will be needed. 3 = Nothing from the client will be needed to change data in the DB.
        Parameters:
        opcode - The opcode of the action to perform.
        extraParamInt - Any extra integer parameter read from the client opening message.
        extraParamString - Any extra String parameter read from the client opening message.

      • sendItemListToClient

        private void sendItemListToClient()
        Sends the list of items in the inventory to the client. If the list fails to write, instead sends an error message. This should result in an error on the client side.

      • sendSupplierListToClient

        private void sendSupplierListToClient()
        Sends the list of suppliers to the client. If the list fails to write, instead sends an error message. This should result in an error on the client side.

      • sendOrderListToClient

        private void sendOrderListToClient()
        Sends the list of orders to the client. If the list fails to write, instead sends an error message. This should result in an error on the client side.

      • updateItemFromClient

        private void updateItemFromClient()
        Receives an item from the client. Across the server and in the database, either updates the item in the item lists if it already exists, or adds a new item to those lists.

      • updateItemListFromClient

        private void updateItemListFromClient()
        Receives a list of ItemModel from the client. Updates the item list across the server and the database.

      • updateSupplierListFromClient

        private void updateSupplierListFromClient()
        Receives a list of SupplierModel from the client. Updates the supplier list across the server and the database.

      • updateOrderListFromClientPrompt

        private void updateOrderListFromClientPrompt()
        Checks the quantities of the items in the item lists. If necessary, create orders and update all server order lists and the database.

      • createOrderFromClientIntQuantity

        private void createOrderFromClientIntQuantity(int quantityToOrder)
        Receives an item from the client, and a quantity to order. Checks if the item exists in the server, and it it does, orders the item according to the desired amount.
        Parameters:
        quantityToOrder - The amount of the item to order.

      • deleteItemFromClient

        private void deleteItemFromClient()
        Searches for a given item from the client. Then, attempts to delete the version of that item from the item lists of the server and the database.

      • searchItemFromClient

        private void searchItemFromClient(int itemSearchId)
        Searches for an item using an id, sending it to the client if it is found. If the item cannot be found, sends an error message to the client. If there is no search method for the given search parameter, do nothing.
        Parameters:
        itemSearchId - The item id to look for.

      • searchItemFromClient

        private void searchItemFromClient(java.lang.String itemSearchName)
        Searches for an item using a name, sending it to the client if it is found. If the item cannot be found, sends an error message to the client. If there is no search method for the given search parameter, do nothing.
        Parameters:
        itemSearchName - The item name to look for.

      • sendErrorToClient

        protected void sendErrorToClient()
        Writes an error to the client.

      • cloneArrayList

        protected <T> java.util.ArrayList<T> cloneArrayList(java.util.ArrayList<T> ogList)
        Generic method that returns a cloned version of a given ArrayList. Requires T to be cloneable.
        Parameters:
        ogList - The original list to clone.
        Returns:
        a cloned list.

      • run

        public void run()
        Runnable run method. Runs the server by waiting for client requests, then fulfilling those requests, before waiting again. When the client manually disconnects, closes all streams before this method terminates.
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable
